intro: Sinapi pinnipartitum, commonly known as the narrow-leafed mustard, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cross-shaped flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with pinnately divided leaves that give it its scientific name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and fields. Sinapi pinnipartitum is an annual herb that blooms from spring to early summer.
